summary:
I did my bachelor degree in Food Technology Departement, Faculty of Industrial Technology, Universitas Pelita Harapan (UPH). After finishing undergraduate, I went to work at Food Technology Department, UPH as lecturer assistant.  Currently, I was graduated from master programme Wageningen University & Research in Food Technology, Specialisation Dairy Science and Technology. 

During my master studies, I am also an awardee of Anne Van den Ban Fund (ABF), Dairy Science and Technology (DST) fellowship, and Holland Scholarship International Master Programme from Wageningen University and Research.

I'm a hard-worker, organised, and adaptable with interest in working on the relation with protein, ingredients, and dairy product development. Right now, I continue working at Universitas Pelita Harapan as an associate lecturer in Food Technology Study Program

awards.title: Holland Scholarship International Master Programme
awards.description: Academic Scholarship for students who are intending to pursue a master degree in the Netherlands. The Holland Scholarship is meant for international students from outside the European Economic Area (EEA) who want to do their bachelor’s or master’s in the Netherlands. It is financed by the Dutch Ministry of Education, Culture and Science as well as several Dutch research universities and universities of applied sciences.

projects.title: Food Factory-4-Us- International Students Competition Game
projects.description:
The Erasmus+ European Food-STA project opens a call for an international Students competition game with teams from different universities of European and no-European countries will compete on finding the best solutions on one specific process – and/or food-industry- related problem.

Our team were candidate for this competition and trying to develop ideas and solutions relevant for food industry with specific action on improvement and innovation of food processing as well as quality and safe foods

In this competition, we try to incorporate friendly bacteria for the development of  temperature stable ice cream entitled " Incorporation of Friendly Bacteria BsIA produced by Bacillus subtilis for the Development of a Temperature-Stable Ice cream"

projects.title: DEVELOPMENT OF DURIAN SEED STARCH BASED- LDPE BIOCOMPOSITE
projects.description:
The difficulties of plastic material to be degraded in environment have developed an urgency to find a suitable replacer for packaging material. Starch is a biodegradable polymer produced in abundance which have been used extensively as a replacer for plastic polymer. Previous research has been able to incorporate 50% of durian starches into a plastic packaging. However the resulted plastic has low physical and mechanical properties. Therefore in this research additional plasticizer and filler were added to improve the physical and mechanical properties of the durian biocomposite.
Chitosan has been widely used as a material or addition in the various plastic biocomposite due to unique structure and biocompability with various material. Chitosan addition is known to increase the biodegradation rate and physicochemical characteristic of bioplastic. Therefore in this research formulated biocomposites using combination of durian starches, sago starches and chitosan were made and tested for its physicochemical properties and biodegradable quality after burial in soil medium for 6 weeks. Water Absorption Characteristic, Degradation Rate, Physical and Mechanical Properties and SEM analysis were perfomed to furthed divulge the potency of the new formulated biocomposite.

projects.title: Analysis of Various Local Frying Oil Characteristics In a Repeated Frying Model
projects.description:
Re-use of frying oil is a common practice in Indonesia. Quality of re-used oil will easily change during repeated frying. In this research, four types of oil obtained locally (palm, coconut, soybean, and corn oil) were used in a repeated frying model using tempeh as food model. The repetition was done until 15 times at 180°C± 50°C with 5 minutes frying time in each repetition and 5 minutes intermittent time between each repetition. 
GC analysis showed decrease in total fatty acid in all oils, especially in those abundant in poly-unsaturated fatty acid while there is aninsignificant increase in trans fatty acids throughout the frying. There is a significant effect of oil type and frying repetition toward the deterioration level of frying oil.
The deteriorations are also exhibited in the gradual increase of the FFA, Totox values and the increase in the formation of secondary oxidation products (conjugated diene and triene). Sensory analysis showed that rancid aroma of palm and coconut oil gradually increased until the 15th frying, meanwhile soybean and corn oil reached their peak point on the 1st frying and remained stable until the 15th frying. Rancid aroma was also found higher in tempeh fried with the 15th times used oil along with savory taste and preference.

contributors.headline: Head of Food Processing Laboratory at Universitas Pelita Harapan

projects.title: The Utilization of Types and Combination of Lactic Acid Bacteria in The Making of Cassava Flour Fermentation
projects.description:
Cassava was known as good source of carbohydrate, but it has relatively short shelf life, low of protein content, low quality of baking properties, and contain anti-nutrient compound (cyanide). Fermentation using lactic acid bacteria is known to produce lactic acid which contributing on baking expansion properties, but strains of lactic acid has different ability to degrade starch. 
In this research, cassava was fermented using mixed culture: Saccharomayces cerevisiae with L.plantarum, L.achidophilus, dan combination between L.plantarum dan L.achidophilus with ratio 1:1. Different fermentation time, fermentation temperature, starter and skim concentration were observed in order to produce fermented cassava flour with high content of protein, low cyanide concentration, and good baking properties. 
Analysis was conduct for selected fermented cassava flour: protein content, cyanide content, spesific volume, peak viscosity using RVA, and whiteness level. 


is obtain fermentation cassava flour with good characteristic by protein content, cyanide content, peak viscosity using (RVA), whiteness level, and baking expansion properties. In this research, fermentation done by mixed starter Sacharomyces cerevisiae 2% and type of lactic acid bacteria (Lactobacillus plantarum, L. achidophilus, and the combination L. plantarum and  L. achidophilus).

profile_positions.description:
After completing my Master degree, I continue my career in academic field as an Associate Lecturer. These are the list of my task as an associate lecturer:
1. Teaching for courses: Milk Processing Technology, Food Processing Technology Laboratory, Food Packaging and Storage Technology, Food Microbiology, Food Biochemistry, Food Processing Microbiology, Basic Microbiology Laboratory, Food Microbiology Laboratory, Food Quality Assurance, Food Quality Assurance Laboratory.
2. Co-Supervisor for thesis student within the topics about Glucosamine, Chitosan, Food Product Development (Edible Film Making, Noodle Processing with the utilization of Chia Seed and Butterfly Pea Flower, Sheeted Jam Processing, Fermented Beverage Processing)
3. Internship Supervisor for Intern Student within the topics about the production process and quality control in food industries
4. Led the Research Project together with other Lecturer and Student that supported by the LPPM (Lembaga Penelitian dan Pengabdian Masyarakat) UPH within the topics about food product development and glucosamine
5. Led the Community Service project together with other Lecturer and Student that supported by the LPPM (Lembaga Penelitian dan Pengabdian Masyarakat) UPH 
6. Coordinator of HMPSTP (Himpunan Mahasiswa Program Studi Teknologi Pangan). HMTP is a student internal organization under Food Technology Study Program
7. Committee for several tasks in the Faculty and Study Program Level
profile_positions.title: Associate Lecturer

profile_positions.description:
Job desk as a lecture assistant in Food Technology Department, Faculty of Science and Technology Universitas Pelita Harapan:
1.Teaching, preparing and organizing materials for practical course:
   food microbiology, food processing technology, biology, unit operation, basic microbiology, food  
   biochemistry, food storage and warehousing, quality control, and also food analysis.

2.  Involve in work lab lecture’s project, attending  scientific seminar, keeping track of student attendance, grading papers, worksheet, and exam.

3. Committe of accreditation team Food Technology Department, Faculty of Science and Technology Universitas Pelita Harapan (Standard 5: Curriculum, Teaching, and Learning Process)
   -Job desk for committe of acreditation of Food Technology department: preparing documents    
   according of the division in the accreditation team structural. In my division. i was responsible to 
   prepare documents that related with curriculum, teaching and learning process such as checking 
  the credit for each course, collect and filing the exam paper, course guide and course outline for 
  each course

4. Involve in the Research and Community Development activities at Food Technology Department
    -I was involved with other lectures or lecture assistant to held activity for community 
    development as part to achieve vision and mission of Food Technology Department, Universitas 
    Pelita Harapan which is to become one of the center of food technology development in 
   Indonesia. In this activity, we hold  some training for the local community in West Java area    
   (Jakarta, Tangerang, Sukabumi) about knowledge in food technology
profile_positions.title: Lecture Assistant
